page.title: 17HISTORY AND HEALTH
page.content:
{ ASHLUDIE HOSPITAL}now extended,once belonged to a local laird.Geriatric patients are treated there. { St Mary's}was originally the Gerard Cottage Hospital.In 1970 Sisters of St Mary Namur made it a home for 30 elderly residents.The Servite Order now tend them.30 senior citizens live in Sheltered Housing at Tay Court. The{Health Centre}near Seaview School is where the local doctors hold their surgeries.Other medical services are available.School dentists have clinics Our MOH has her baby clinic on Mondays
People are conscious of{health}and {weight.}Doctors hand out diet sheets and tell people to get their weight down.Chemists stock reducing tablets and drinks.Joggers jog at all times. Sedentary occupations and convenience foods are evils as are too many sweets
